alert.note: Alert for Kingfisher; Kiowa (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 07 at 10:09PM CDT until July 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WASHITA...SOUTHWESTERN KINGFISHER...CADDO... NORTHEASTERN KIOWA...BLAINE AND WESTERN CANADIAN COUNTIES... At 1009 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles east of Hitchcock to 3 miles south of Binger to 6 miles southeast of Carnegie, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Anadarko, Watonga, Hinton, Carnegie, Geary, Hydro, Mountain View, Binger, Fort Cobb, Canton, Calumet, Cement, Eakly, Gracemont, Gotebo, Lookeba, Colony, Hitchcock, Bridgeport, and Greenfield. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
